SKATER COLLECTION

Skateboarding culture has become increasingly popular worldwide in recent years. Shinpei Ueno and Alex Olson, both skaters who started out on the streets, are now active in multiple fields, including fashion, design, and film. This collection features their artworks drawn exclusively for UT and a newly developed T-shirt silhouette.

Shinpei Ueno
As well as overseeing TIGHTBOOTH PRODUCTION, he also skates for Evisen Skateboards as a pro skater. He has released many skateboarding videos, and his most well-known work, “LENZ II,” was highly acclaimed both in Japan and abroad. He works in a wide variety of fields, including direction for a skate shop and apparel brand, and production for numerous brands. “LENZ III,” which completes the TIGHTBOOTH skateboarding video trilogy, was released worldwide in November 2022.

© Shinpei Ueno

Yusuke Hanai

Yusuke Hanai is a renowned graphic artist known for his unique style, heavily influenced by the counterculture of the '50s and '60s. He seamlessly blends Japanese aesthetic sensibility with retro American illustration. This collection of graphic T-shirts is based on the theme of "ONE STEP FORWARD," promoting environmentally conscious actions, and features his latest artwork printed on fabric made from recycled polyester.

Yusuke Hanai
Born in 1978, Yusuke Hanai is a globally recognized artist, having exhibited his works in various countries including the United States, France, Australia, Brazil, Taiwan, England. His style, characterized by its cynical and humorous storytelling, has garnered widespread attention both in Japan and internationally.

© Yusuke Hanai

“The Bling Ring” (2013)
Based on a true story in the U.S., this documentary-style film depicts the unique morals of today's youth living in social networks.

"LET'S GO SHOPPING"
This is a symbolic phrase uttered by Rebecca, the leader of the group, in the main scene of the story in which the youths break into the homes of celebrities and steal brand-name goods.

Celebrating Sofia Coppola

The film by Sofia Coppola, celebrating the 25th anniversary of her debut, offers a beautiful view of the world with straightforward language and unique visual beauty that makes life seem still. The film expresses the girly sentiments of the women in the film with an exquisite and feminine aesthetic. We designed a T-shirt using the scenes and lines depicted in the film. The body silhouette, which has a girly nuance but is also easy for men to wear, is also noteworthy.

Sofia Coppola
Born in 1971 and raised in Northern California, Sofia Coppola released her first feature film, The Virgin Suicides, as the director and screenwriter in 1999. Sofia has created seven feature films to date. Beloved by fans for the artistry and originality of her scripts, she was awarded Best Director at the 2017 Cannes Film Festival.

“Marie Antoinette” (2006)
Sofia Coppola reinterprets the life of one undisputed Marie Antoinette as a 14-year-old girl in this stylish coming-of-age film that expresses the quiet strength of a woman. Filmed over a three-month period at the Palace of Versailles in France, the film was also notable for its use of modern-day items, such as sneakers, in its depiction.

“IT'S NOT TOO MUCH IS IT?"
The design is an arrangement of the words that show a part of Marie Antoinette's desire to remain strong, symbolizing her fearless and flamboyant spirit.

items.longDescription:
Graphic design inspired by the Wind God and Thunder God hanging scrolls by the great painter and woodblock artist Kawanabe Kyōsai (1831–1889).
In Japanese mythology, the Wind God wields a cloth bag that unleashes torrential wind and rain. Since ancient times, the Wind God has been revered for its ability to calm typhoons and storms that wreak havoc on crops.
This T-shirt depicts the mighty Wind God on a background the color of traditional Japanese persimmon-dyed textiles.

Japanese Art from the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston

The Museum of Fine Arts, Boston, is one of the premier art institutions in the world. The museum is renowned for its vast collection of Japanese artwork and long history of cultural exchange with Japan. items.longDescription:
“Somewhere” (2010)
A film about Johnny Marco, a movie star living a celebrity life, who is reunited with his 11-year-old daughter, who grew up with his divorced wife, and reevaluates his life. Winner of the Golden Lion at the 67th Venice International Film Festival.

“SORRY, WHAT WAS THE QUESTION?"
These are the words of movie star Johnny Marco in response to a journalist's question at a press conference.
The design is based on the line that symbolizes a scene in which the protagonist leads an empty life.

Celebrating Sofia Coppola

The film by Sofia Coppola, celebrating the 25th anniversary of her debut, offers a beautiful view of the world with straightforward language and unique visual beauty that makes life seem still. The film expresses the girly sentiments of the women in the film with an exquisite and feminine aesthetic. We designed a T-shirt using the scenes and lines depicted in the film. The body silhouette, which has a girly nuance but is also easy for men to wear, is also noteworthy.

Sofia Coppola
Born in 1971 and raised in Northern California, Sofia Coppola released her first feature film, The Virgin Suicides, as the director and screenwriter in 1999. Sofia has created seven feature films to date. Beloved by fans for the artistry and originality of her scripts, she was awarded Best Director at the 2017 Cannes Film Festival.

We feature a one point embroidery of the character "Daijin," whose mysterious presence enlivens the story in "Suzume". On the back is a design of the curious "Suzume's chair”. This design celebrates the cuteness of the two characters who face each other in the movie.

Makoto Shinkai

Born in Nagano Prefecture, Japan in 1973, Makoto Shinkai makes his commercial debut with the short film he produced on his own, “Voices of a Distant Star.” Since, he has gone onto direct films such as “The Place Promised in Our Early Days (2004),” “5 Centimeters per Second (2007),” “Children Who Chase Lost Voices (2011)” and “The Garden of Words (2013).” Finally, in 2016, he directs “Your Name,” an international sensation and social phenomenon in Japan, and quickly follows it up with “Weathering with You” in 2019, which set box office records in Japan. In November 2022, his latest film, “Suzume” will be shown in domestic movie theaters.

MAKOTO SHINKAI FILMS COLLECTION

Director Makoto Shinkai creates social phenomena with his delicate depictions of daily life and stirring dramatic stories. This special collection, only available at Uniqlo, will celebrate the upcoming release of his latest feature-length animated film, "Suzume".

© 2022 SNTFP

Graphic design inspired by the Wind God and Thunder God hanging scrolls by the great painter and woodblock artist Kawanabe Kyōsai (1831–1889).
In Japanese mythology, the Wind God wields a cloth bag that unleashes torrential wind and rain. Since ancient times, the Wind God has been revered for its ability to calm typhoons and storms that wreak havoc on crops.
This sweatshirt the color of traditional Japanese plant-dyes pays tribute to the mighty Wind God on the back, with leaves dancing in the wind on the front.
